components.description:
A glowing, five-point gold star. Depicted as ‚≠ê Star with stylized bursts in between its points, representing glowing or twinkling.

Commonly used to represent various senses of glowing as well for as for a sense of flourish. Not to be confused with üí´ Dizzy, ‚≠ê Star, üå† Shooting Star, or ‚ú® Sparkles, though their applications may overlap.

On Snapchat, this emoji displays next to a contact who has had their snaps replayed in the past 24 hours.

Microsoft’s bursts were previously blue lines, Apple’s star previously resembled its ‚≠ê Star emoji, and Samsung’s star previously displayed a burst radiating out from its center.
components.title: Glowing Star

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Moon, sun, and star symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A five-point star of pale-yellow color, with small bursts of light shining around it. Generally used for visual flair rather than astronomic http://emojipedia.org/glowing-star/
emoji_net_data.name: glowing star

bn:00103623a: As if shining with a brilliant light; radiant.

bn:00096670a: Having brief brilliant points or flashes of light

bn:00105808a: Indicating the most important performer or role

bn:00098857a: Emitting or reflecting light readily or in large amounts

bn:00092637v: Be bright by reflecting or casting light
To bend back (light, etc.) from a surface.

bn:00083216v: To give off light from heat or to emit light as if heated.
Emit light; be bright, as of the sun or a light
To emit beams of light; shine; radiate.

bn:00094295v: Be the star in a performance

bn:00073964n: Sphere of plasma held together by gravity, undergoing fusion
A luminous celestial body that is made from gases (particularly hydrogen and helium) and forms the shape of a sphere.
This article is for quotes about stars, or which make prominent mention of stars.
(astronomy) a celestial body of hot gases that radiates energy derived from thermonuclear reactions in the interior
A star is a massive, luminous sphere of plasma held together by its own gravity.
A luminous celestial body, made up of plasma (particularly hydrogen and helium) and having a spherical shape. Depending on context the sun may or may not be included.

bn:00051116n: A sparkle of delight in the eyes.
The brightness of the eye or eyes.
Merriment expressed by a brightness or gleam or animation of countenance

bn:03762703n: Glitter describes an assortment of very small, flat, reflective particles.
Assortment of very small, flat, reflective particles

bn:00025236n: Night or nighttime is the period of time between the sunset and the sunrise when the Sun is below the horizon.
The time after sunset and before sunrise while it is dark outside
The period between sunset and sunrise, when a location faces far away from the sun, thus when the sky is dark.
Night is the period of time when the sun is below the horizon.
Part of the day when the Sun is not aloft
The hours of darkness between sunset and sunrise; the night.
